article_title: A Clumsy Law Makes U.S. Expats Financial Lepers — Letters to the Editor
article_text: In regard to Neil Gandal’s Dec. 16 op-ed “Why Does Uncle Sam Hate American Expats?”: In England, a 74-year-old woman, a U.K. resident for 50 years, has been kicked out of her retirement account by a major British financial institution. Why? Because she is American—one of the new lepers no foreign financial company wants as a client. The IRS has threatened draconian fines on any foreign brokerages that sell passive foreign-investment companies to Americans. This is taking place because of the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act...
